author: Kristina Peterson
title: Conservatives See Farm Bill’s Sugar Program as Too Sweet
text:
WASHINGTON—House Republican leaders have scheduled a vote on the farm bill for Friday, but haven’t yet resolved lingering GOP concerns over major planks of the legislation, including its support for the U.S. sugar industry.
GOP leaders have little room to maneuver, as they are trying to pass the new, five-year farm bill with just Republican votes. Most Democrats are expected to oppose it over provisions that tighten the work requirements for those receiving food stamps.
...
